Apple has introduced a new 9.7-inch iPad that will challenge Chromebooks for supremacy in classrooms. It supports the Apple Pencil, which means students will be able to take notes, draw and more on a growing array of apps.

Starting at $329 ($299 for schools), the 1-pound iPad has an A10 processor that offers faster speeds than Apple's previous generation slate. It also offers augmented reality capabilities, which provides a new way to learn. However, the Apple Pencil will still be sold separately ($89 for students).
